revised_title: Isotopic and Chemical Systematics of Caledonian Intrusions in Scotland and Northern England
tldr: This study examines the chemical and isotopic systematics of the Caledonian intrusions in Scotland and Northern England, providing insights into the magma source regions and magma-crust interactions. The research finds that the intrusions were derived from both mantle and crustal sources, with the majority being dominated by recycled continental crust. The findings contribute to the understanding of the petrogenesis of the British Caledonian Granitoids.
